snippet: Air-quality regulators in Southern California approved new rules today that paint manufacturers say will force them to spend hundreds of millions of dollars to develop formulas that do not release polluting fumes.    The new rules are scheduled to...
lead_paragraph: Air-quality regulators in Southern California approved new rules today that paint manufacturers say will force them to spend hundreds of millions of dollars to develop formulas that do not release polluting fumes. The new rules are scheduled to be phased in from 2002 to 2006.
abstract: Air-quality regulators in Southern California approve new rules that paint manufacturers say will force them to spend hundreds of millions of dollars to develop formulas that do not release polluting fumes; new rules are scheduled to be phased in from 2002 to 2006; they are designed to reduce vapors released from paint as it dries that are thought to contribute to smog and ozone (M)

headline.main: Tough Rules Are Approved For New Paint
